title: dkbit98
author: dkbit98
created_time: March 09, 2023, 08:37:44 PMLast edit: April 14, 2023, 07:50:30 PM by dkbit98
content: I didn't see anyone talking about Peach Bitcoin, but this is probably one of the best mobile P2P trading app alternative for Bisq exchange (that only works on computers).Peach Bitcoin is mobile application that connects Bitcoin buyers and sellers without the need for any KYC verification or registration.It works anywhere, anytime and you can choose many payment options including cash that you can exchange in bitcoin meetups in Europe.Other payment methods available are Bank Transfers, Online Paymemts (Paypal, Revolut, ADVcash, Mobile Pay, Wise...), Gift Cards, and various National Options depending on your location and currency.I think that Peach Bitcoin is currently available only in Europe, but there are plans to expand to other regions in the world.All payment methods are available are listed on their website:https://peachbitcoin.com/how-it-works/#paymentPeach Bitcoin app is available both on Android and iOS devices and only supported cryptocurrency is Bitcoin.One issue I have is the fact that source code is private and not open source, but maybe this can change in future.https://peachbitcoin.com/If you downloaded and tested this app please write your feedback below with pros and cons.I am not affiliated with PeachBitcoin in any way, so use it at your own risk.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Doesn't everything sound too good about PeachBitcoin to be true? No registration, no KYC. Although the source code is closed, what could be a reason to pause is introducing large sums to this platform. Unless to test with a small deposit.Have you, dkbit98, used this P2P mobile app yourself? Why do you consider "this is probably one of the best mobile P2P trading app"?The question of the number of active users of the exchanger also remains open.If this trading platform takes into account the interests of its users as much as possible, simplifying the exchange process, then how soon will regulators pay attention to this mobile app and tighten the use (or block it altogether)?When everything is very good, this is a reason to be wary. Also, regulators will not like such sweet conditions either, like PeachBitcoin.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: It is difficult to trust them, especially since they do not have a web application. All the service is done by downloading a closed-source app, which makes me doubt the percentage of their trading volumes, or the inability to impose identity verification in the future, or at least sell user data.According to them privacy-policy page -----> https://peachbitcoin.com/privacy-policy/QuotePeach Sàrl is a company registered, organized and existing under the laws of Switzerland, under company registration number CHE-158.025.408 whose registered office is at:Rue des Beaux-Arts 8c/o LEAX Avocats Sàrl2000 NeuchâtelSWITZERLANDI have no legal experience, but it is impossible for a company registered in Switzerland not to provide financial services without verifying identity or requesting user data.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: m2017 on March 10, 2023, 02:16:15 AMDoesn't everything sound too good about PeachBitcoin to be true? No it doesn't.I clearly said I don't like closed source code, and the fact that this is not available worldwide in countries outside Europe.Quote from: m2017 on March 10, 2023, 02:16:15 AMHave you, dkbit98, used this P2P mobile app yourself? Why do you consider "this is probably one of the best mobile P2P trading app"?I didn't use it yet because there are currently no cash meetups in my region, but I will try testing it with PayPal and few other options soon.It's the best P2P mobile app simply because there is nothing better available right now, it's like Bisq for mobile.Quote from: m2017 on March 10, 2023, 02:16:15 AMIf this trading platform takes into account the interests of its users as much as possible, simplifying the exchange process, then how soon will regulators pay attention to this mobile app and tighten the use (or block it altogether)?Nobody stopped Bitcoin, nobody stopped Bisq, and nobody stopped torrents, so it's not going to be easy to stop PeachBitcoin, but that is not my concern anyway.Quote from: hugeblack on March 10, 2023, 08:21:31 AMIt is difficult to trust them, especially since they do not have a web application. All the service is done by downloading a closed-source app, which makes me doubt the percentage of their trading volumes, or the inability to impose identity verification in the future, or at least sell user data.Dude, it's P2P, you don't have to trust them, this is not centralized exchange and they can't sell data they don't have  I don't know what ''trading volume'' you are talking about... I will repeat... this is not centralized exchange.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on March 10, 2023, 12:28:20 PMDude, it's P2P, you don't have to trust them, this is not centralized exchange and they can't sell data they don't have  I don't know what ''trading volume'' you are talking about... I will repeat... this is not centralized exchange.According to their privacy page, they are registered in Switzerland, however, you say they without the need for any KYC verification or registration.As for the data, I am talking about your bank account or any other data. You must send them during trading, and therefore it may be sent to the tax authorities.In terms of trust, downloading an unknown source application is the problem.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on March 10, 2023, 02:06:18 PMAccording to their privacy page, they are registered in Switzerland, however, you say they without the need for any KYC verification or registration.I can also create an app and register it anywhere I want, and I would avoid using banks if possible.Quote from: hugeblack on March 10, 2023, 02:06:18 PMAs for the data, I am talking about your bank account or any other data. You must send them during trading, and therefore it may be sent to the tax authorities.There is nothing you are going to send for P2P cash meetups, and that is something I am mostly excited for.If you look at the map they posted on website you would see location for all current meetups, and new ones are coming up every day.https://peachbitcoin.com/for-meetups/Quote from: hugeblack on March 10, 2023, 02:06:18 PMIn terms of trust, downloading an unknown source application is the problem.Yeah, but if you are using smartphone you are already using unknown source for your operating system and for most of the apps  Nobody is stopping someone to create something similar that would be with open source code, there is clear demand for stuff like this.

comments.author: n0nce
comments.body: If it just 'matches' people without offering a security benefit over e.g. finding trading peers on a forum, I would feel somewhat insecure using it.What I like about Bisq or Robosats is that they have different ways of ensuring neither party can easily run with the other trading partner's money. Bisq uses a custom script with different levels of fallback (mediation, arbitration; 2-of-3 in the past and yet another, better system in Bisq 2 as far as I know). Robosats acts as a trusted escrow.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: n0nce on March 10, 2023, 06:55:59 PMIf it just 'matches' people without offering a security benefit over e.g. finding trading peers on a forum, I would feel somewhat insecure using it.PeachBitcoin uses Multi-Signature bitcoin addresses to make sure that everything works fine during trade, so nobody can run away with money, and you can even interact with other peeps using the encrypted chat in app.I suggest reading Support FAQ page on website to see how Peach Bitcoin works, and please write below if you notice anything that you don't like. My oppinion is that Bisq is better option for computers, but PeachBitcoin is very good alternative for mobile devices, if you are willing to accept some drawbacks.

comments.author: dansus021
comments.body: Just checked the website on who isThe domain is registered on January 2022 so not a surprise there are not many users that talking about it. The company still hiring a lot of people. Join Us page - https://peachbitcoin.com/join-us/ KYC is not required let's see till when this gonna survive   But this is a good platform tho. Where did you find it in the first place?

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Thank you for this topic. Peach Bitcoin is still new and not as popular as Bisk. It even has a low rank on Alexa and Tranco. In addition, there are not enough reviews about this platform on Google or YouTube, although it has been live for nearly a year. In addition, the domain owner's information is hidden, and we cannot identify it or the platform team; also, why did PeachBitcoin put the whitepaper for Bitcoin on their platform? Why didn't they put a whitepaper containing important information about their platform, application, and team? The last thing is that I could not download the application from Google Play or the App Store because the application appears to have been deleted or does not exist. Did you download the APK file from the PeachBitcoin website?[1] https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.peachbitcoin.peach.mainnet[2] https://peachbitcoin.com/bitcoin.pdf

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: dansus021 on March 17, 2023, 02:00:26 AMBut this is a good platform tho. Where did you find it in the first place?I first heard about Peach Bitcoin from bitcoiners on Twitter.Quote from: albon on March 17, 2023, 09:35:22 PMWhy didn't they put a whitepaper containing important information about their platform, application, and team? Whitepapers are usually released by shitcoins nowadays and I never saw a single business or wallet releasing that, it doesn't make any sense to do it.They are registered company and they are not trying to hide from anyone, there is clear limitation for amount of money you can exchange per day.Quote from: albon on March 17, 2023, 09:35:22 PMThe last thing is that I could not download the application from Google Play or the App Store because the application appears to have been deleted or does not exist. Did you download the APK file from the PeachBitcoin website?It works just fine for me bothon google play and direct APK file from their website.

comments.author: LeGaulois
comments.body: Nice findingIt look like more a LocalBitcoins alternative than Bisq, but still welcome in our industry I would say. There is no KYC because Switzerland is not bothering with ID verification. There is for exemple a popular app there called Relai we can buy or sell BTC without giving your IDI will probably give a try to Peachbitcoin to replace with Bisq.If someone is interest in the User Interface;Quote from: albon on March 17, 2023, 09:35:22 PMAlexa Rank, seriously in 2023? On May 1, 2022, Amazon shut down Alexa Internet which subsequently discontinued Alexa Rank with it.Quotethe domain owner's information is hidden, and we cannot identify it or the platform teamAre you trolling? It's written on theit website and someone postetd the info just above youQuotewhy did PeachBitcoin put the whitepaper for Bitcoin on their platform? Why didn't they put a whitepaper containing important information about their platform, application, and team?why this and why that...The real question is why didn't you read the website in which it's clearly written your "important information"

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: LeGaulois on March 18, 2023, 11:48:32 PMAlexa Rank, seriously in 2023? On May 1, 2022, Amazon shut down Alexa Internet which subsequently discontinued Alexa Rank with it.You seem to be blindly platform biased, and I hope that your trust will not be disappointed in the end, There are many sites that offer the same Alexa service that gives you traffic and ranks like Alexa can determine for you that the platform has poor traffic.Quote from: LeGaulois on March 18, 2023, 11:48:32 PMAre you trolling? It's written on theit website and someone postetd the info just above youIt's true?? It seems that your vision is 6/6, well, can you give me the name of the domain owner?  And the names and information about the PeachBitcoin team?Quote from: LeGaulois on March 18, 2023, 11:48:32 PMWhy this and why that...The real question is why didn't you read the website in which it's clearly written your "important information"And why don't you tell us how much they paid you for writing this? Yes I can find some information on their website, but there are a lot of things missing, but I'm asking why they put a Bitcoin whitepaper and didn't write one for their platform/App, or does the platform you are defending have no capital to hire someone to do this?

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.created_time: March 19, 2023, 07:56:04 AMLast edit: March 19, 2023, 08:39:17 AM by Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: albon on March 19, 2023, 12:40:39 AM Yes I can find some information on their website, but there are a lot of things missing, but I'm asking why they put a Bitcoin whitepaper and didn't write one for their platform/App, or does the platform you are defending have no capital to hire someone to do this?Yeah its really weird that application called Peach Bitcoin that is used to "Buy & Sell Bitcoin peer-to-peer" has a Bitcoin whitepaper on the website.   After all, why would a working app that is used for anonymous trade of Bitcoin have whitepaper, team members etc? This is not some altcoin project that is trying to raise the money so they have to make bunch of bullshit claims in order to persuade people to invest.App looks interesting and could be used (at least speaking from my pov) for example when you are in a different country and you have to sell some bitcoin ASAP, but for domestic use here in Croatia we have local TG groups where you can do the same thing.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: LeGaulois on March 18, 2023, 11:48:32 PMIt look like more a LocalBitcoins alternative than Bisq, but still welcome in our industry I would say. There is no KYC because Switzerland is not bothering with ID verification. They ask verification for larger amount of money, I think for more than 1000 CHF per day traded you need to do verification anywhere, and you can easily override that in Bitcoin meetups. Quote from: LeGaulois on March 18, 2023, 11:48:32 PMThere is for exemple a popular app there called Relai we can buy or sell BTC without giving your IDI know about Relai but I think you can only use bank account for trading, in PeachBitcoin there are much more options, and they are open to adding new payment option specific to certain country.Bisq is better than Peach in many ways, but I can't easily use it on smartphone, and I think they said it's not even in their roadmap to make something like that.However, I don't think Peach can fully replace Bisq, and they are still in beta phase so bugs are always possible.Quote from: Rikafip on March 19, 2023, 07:56:04 AMApp looks interesting and could be used (at least speaking from my pov) for example when you are in a different country and you have to sell some bitcoin ASAP, but for domestic use here in Croatia we have local TG groups where you can do the same thing. It's good to have options to choose, and people should be able to try what works better.In Peach app is much harder to get scammed by someone because multisig setup is used, and you can trade with someone in person or make remotely (paypal, banks, gift cards, etc.)

comments.author: icopress
comments.body: Quote from: albon on March 17, 2023, 09:35:22 PMIn addition, the domain owner's information is hidden, and we cannot identify it or the platform team; also, why did PeachBitcoin put the whitepaper for Bitcoin on their platform? Probably because this is one of the projects that does not care about the lawsuits and intimidation of Craig Wright.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: icopress on March 24, 2023, 08:38:55 PMProbably because this is one of the projects that does not care about the lawsuits and intimidation of Craig Wright.Is Faketoshi still doing this failed lawsuit circus thing?I don't follow news around him so much, so maybe he returned working in agriculture and growing vegetables like in past  Full disclosure for current version of PeachBitcoin, last information I saw is that orderbook information is stored for 10 years, probably because of some Swiss law.Peach is closed source so we don't know what is happening inside app, but there are some good rumors they are preparing to release everything as open source, but let's wait and see.Close beta testing for Peach is completed, and app v 0.2.2 is now latest version available in public.

comments.author: LeGaulois
comments.body: Sharing a few more screenshots to show how PeachBitcoin worksYou don't see the available offers, like you could see with LocalBitcoins and co.You need to create an offer and then you see the ones that match your criteria (amount, payment method).You then swipe like you do on Tinder.          Creating an offer                          Choosing your payment method                        Filling your BTC adress You've got a match. If you don't like the seller "peach02cf85" (that's the username), you swipe on your screen to go the next offer with your requirements.The seller then receive a notification on his smartphone and need to open the application. Hopefully he isn't sleeping...There is also a chat system to talk with the person if you ever want to date

comments.author: Renampun
comments.body: peach bitcoin still seems very new and still focused on reaching users based in Europe (only 7 currencies are supported)pure P2P platform is what many bitcoin users need (can be an alternative choice besides bisq). maybe I will try this platform when they are planning to expand worldwide.#it seems that the "peach bitcoin" developers have to hold advertisements to make their products more known.

comments.author: mendace
comments.body: Quote from: LeGaulois on March 25, 2023, 01:04:46 AMSharing a few more screenshots to show how PeachBitcoin worksYou don't see the available offers, like you could see with LocalBitcoins and co.You need to create an offer and then you see the ones that match your criteria (amount, payment method).You then swipe like you do on Tinder.Yeah excellent app, as far as Italy is concerned I personally had the events https://bitcoinbeer.events (Bitcoin beer) added as a payment method where we meet once a month and talk about the protocol over a good beer.  Then from the app you can select to choose the next BB event as the trading point.
